titleStmt.title: A full and satisfactorie ansvver to the late vnaduised bull, thundred by Pope Paul the Fift, against the renowmed state of Venice being modestly entitled by the learned author, Considerations vpon the censure of Pope Paul the Fift, against the common-wealth of Venice: by Father Paul of Venice, a frier of the order of Serui. Translated out of Italian.
Considerationi sopra le censure della Santità di Papa Paolo V. contra la serenissima republica di Venetia. English
titleStmt.author: Sarpi, Paolo, 1552-1623.

titleStmt.title: A full and satisfactorie ansvver to the late vnaduised bull, thundred by Pope Paul the Fift, against the renowmed state of Venice being modestly entitled by the learned author, Considerations vpon the censure of Pope Paul the Fift, against the common-wealth of Venice: by Father Paul of Venice, a frier of the order of Serui. Translated out of Italian.
Considerationi sopra le censure della Santità di Papa Paolo V. contra la serenissima republica di Venetia. English
titleStmt.author: Sarpi, Paolo, 1552-1623.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [at Eliot's Court Press] for Iohn Bill,

notesStmt.note: A translation of: Sarpi, Paolo. Considerationi sopra le censure della Santità di Papa Paolo V. contra la serenissima republica di Venetia.
Running title reads: An answer to the late bull of Pope Paul the Fift, against the renowmed state of Venice.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
